avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack is considered stable after thawing last weekend. Little snow is left in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has settled well after freeze-thaw cycles and the snowpack is quite stable. Snow profile from Hengill on April 25th showed a isothermal, stable snow pack. Now there is little snow left in the mountains altough small sloughs may release in warm weather.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches released after warming this week in N-Iceland suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snow pack is generally considered stable after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austan 3-8 á sunnudag og stöku skúrir sunnantil. Hiti 7 til 12 stig, en allvíða líkur á næturfrosti.

avalancheActivity.comment: Skier triggered loose snow avalanche on Thursday in Seljalandsdalur. Many avalanches fell last weekend during thaw and rain. Two large slush avalanches have occurred since it stopped raining.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Skier triggered loose snow avalanche on Thursday in Seljalandsdalur. Wet avalanches could occur.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack is likely becoming rather homogenous after freeze-thaw cycles. A snowpit from Steiniðjugil on April 23 showed a rather homogenous and isothermal snowpack. Wet sluffs could occur and some layering could be present at high elevations. Two large slush avalanches have occurred after it became dry.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches released after warming this week in N-Iceland suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snow pack is generally considered stable after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðaustlægar áttir næstu daga. Hiti yfir frostmarki á láglendi næturfrost til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wide slab avalanche fell in Kotafjall in Svarfaðardalur, another smaller one in Skíðadalur on 20.04, another size 2 wet loose avalanche released in Þrastarstaðaskál in Höfðaströnd. Large avalanche in Ljósavatnsskarð (outside of the forecast area) on Wednesday or Thursday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided somewhat in the thaw last weekend and snow has become wet and but not in highest mountains. Snow is affected by diurnal temperature fluctuations and solar radiation. Considerable snow still in high elevations and some slabs persist there. Possible new windslabs in S aspects on Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw during last weekend and snow has subsided and stiffened somewhat, but considerable snow is high in mountains and slabs can persist in high elevations. A snowpit in Burstabrekkudalur on Monday gave CT11RP but ECTX, a weak layer by an ice layer on top of old firn persists. Weak layer can persist in high elevations. Warm temperatures during the day and solar radiation affects the top layers of the snow and chance of wet avalanches. Possible new thin windslabs in SW aspects on Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches released after warming this week in N-Iceland suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snow pack is generally considered stable after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar él möguleg á laugardag og hiti við frostmark. Hlýrra á sunnudag og mánudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Large loose avalanches released on Friday in Hólmatindur. Avalanches released during thaw last weekend, natural and human triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs may be found in the mountains after snow showers on Saturday. Underlying snowpack is considered stable after thaw and diurnal temperature fluctuations this week.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs may be present in southerly aspects during snow showers on Saturday. There is a significant amount of snow in the mountains but a lot of snow melt in the lower elevations this week. The snow pack is considered stable after diurnal temperature fluctuations.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snow pack is generally considered stable and isothermal after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords. Large natural avalanches released after warming this week in N-Iceland suggesting a weaknes may still be active although freeze thaw cycles and mild weather continue to strengthen the snowpack.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snow pack is generally considered stable after freeze thaw cycles in the last days. Small wind slabs may be in the mountains in the East fjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður á sunnudag. Lítilsháttar él til fjalla og norðanátt á mánudag.
